member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMouseMovementRelative(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Simulates moving a mouse pointer relative to the current cursor position.

member.name: M:SharpHook.EventSimulator.SimulateMouseWheel(System.UInt16,System.Int16)
member.remarks: A positive value indicates that the wheel will be rotated down and a negative value indicates that the wheel will be rotated up.

member.name: T:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase
member.summary: Represents an abstract implementation of which raises events only when there is at least one subscriber.

member.param: if should run the hook on a background thread. Otherwise, .

member.param: if should run the hook on a background thread. Otherwise, .

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Finalize
member.summary: Destroys the global hook if it's running.

member.name: P:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the global hook is running.
member.value: if the global hook is running. Otherwise, .

member.name: P:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the global hook is disposed.
member.value: if the global hook is disposed. Otherwise, .
member.remarks: A disposed global hook cannot be started again.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Run
member.summary: Runs the global hook on the current thread, blocking it. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.RunAsync
member.summary: Runs the global hook without blocking the current thread. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.returns: A which finishes when the hook is destroyed.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.
member.remarks: The hook is started on a separate thread.

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.Dispose
member.remarks: After calling this method, the hook cannot be started again. If you want to do that, create a new instance of .

member.name: M:SharpHook.GlobalHookBase.HandleHookEvent(SharpHook.Native.UioHookEvent@)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, represents a strategy for handling a hook event.
member.remarks: Derived classes should call inside this method to raise the appropriate event.

member.name: M:SharpHook.IGlobalHook.Run
member.summary: Runs the global hook on the current thread, blocking it. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.IGlobalHook.RunAsync
member.summary: Runs the global hook without blocking the current thread. The hook can be destroyed by calling the method.
member.returns: A which finishes when the hook is destroyed.
member.exception: Starting the global hook has failed.
The global hook is already running.
The global hook has been disposed.
member.remarks: Since the underlying native API for running a global hook is blocking, the only way to run it without blocking the current thread is to run it on a separate thread.

member.name: T:SharpHook.Logging.EmptyLogSource
member.summary: Represents a souce of libuiohook logs which never raises any events.
member.remarks: This class exists primarily to be used instead of in release builds of client apps as they will most probably not need any logs from libuiohook. Also, unlike this class doesn't need the Visual C++ Redistributable package to be installed on Windows.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.EmptyLogSource.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the log source is disposed.
member.value: if the log source is disposed. Otherwise, .
member.remarks: Since empty log sources don't do anything, it doesn't matter whether they are disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.EmptyLogSource.Dispose
member.remarks: Since empty log sources don't do anything, it doesn't matter whether they are disposed.

member.summary: An event which is never raised.

member.name: E:SharpHook.Logging.ILogSource.MessageLogged

member.name: T:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry
member.summary: Represents a log entry from libuiohook.

remarks.para: For simple handling the and properties are anough. For more advanced handling you can use the entries' formats and arguments.

Each log entry from libuiohook has the following format:
function [line]: message

The function and line reference the source code of libuiohook itself, and can be retrieved using the and properties. The message can be retrieved by splitting the text by : and getting the trimmed second part.
You shouldn't create instances yourself. Instead, use the class to create them in the logging callback.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.#ctor(SharpHook.Native.LogLevel,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The full text of the log entry.
The format of the log entry which can be used in String.Format.
The native format of the log entry.
The arguments of the log entry which can be used in String.Format.
The arguments as they appear in the entry's full text.
The argument placeholders from the native format.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.Level
member.summary: Gets the level of the current log entry.
member.value: The level of the current log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.FullText
member.summary: Gets the full text of the current log entry.
member.value: The full text of the current log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.Format
member.summary: Gets the format of the current log entry.
member.value: The format of the current log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.NativeFormat
member.summary: Gets the native format of the current log entry, as defined in libuiohook.
member.value: The native format of the current log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.Arguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments of the current log entry.
member.value: The arguments of the current log entry.
member.remarks: The function and line are the first two arguments of the log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.RawArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments of the current log entry as they appear in entry's full text.
member.value: The arguments of the current log entry as they appear in entry's full text.
member.remarks: The function and line are the first two arguments of the log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.ArgumentPlaceholders
member.summary: Gets the argument placeholders from the native format.
member.value: The argument placeholders from the native format.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.Function
member.summary: Gets the libuiohook function which called the logger.
member.value: The function which called the logger.
member.remarks: The function is the first argument of the log entry.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntry.SourceLine
member.summary: Gets the source code line in libuiohook where the logger was called.
member.value: The source code line in libuiohook where the logger was called.
member.remarks: The source code line is the second argument of the log entry.

member.name: T:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntryParser
member.summary: Creates log entries from native log formats and arguments.
member.remarks: The log text is formatted using the vsprintf function from the C runtime and then the result is parsed to extract the arguments. This means that on Windows this class requires the Visual C++ Redistributable package to be installed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.LogEntryParser.ParseNativeLogEntry(SharpHook.Native.LogLevel,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Parses a native log format and arguments to create a log entry.
member.param: A pointer to the native format of the log message.
A pointer to the native arguments of the log message.
member.returns: A log entry represented by the level, format, and argumets.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogEventArgs.LogEntry
member.summary: Gets the entry of the current log event.
member.value: The entry of the current log event.

member.name: T:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource
member.summary: Represents a source of libuiohook logs.

remarks.para: Only a single instance must be used at a time.
On Windows this class requires the Visual C++ Redistributable package to be installed as it uses the C runtime.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.MinLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum log level.
member.value: The minimum log level.

member.name: P:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the log source is disposed.
member.value: if the log source is disposed. Otherwise, .
member.remarks: A disposed log source doesn't raise the event and cannot be registered again.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.Register(SharpHook.Native.LogLevel)
member.summary: Creates and registers a source of libuiohook logs.
member.remarks: This method must not be called when another instance has already been registerd and hasn't been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.Register(SharpHook.Providers.ILoggingProvider,SharpHook.Native.LogLevel)
member.summary: Creates and registers a source of libuiohook logs using the specified provider.
member.param: The logging provider used to register the log source.
member.remarks: This method must not be called when another instance has already been registerd and hasn't been disposed.

member.name: M:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.Dispose
member.summary: Stops the currently registered instance from receiving libuiohook logs.

member.name: E:SharpHook.Logging.LogSource.MessageLogged
member.summary: An event which is raised when libuiohook logs a message.

member.summary: Represents a function which is called when an event occurs.

member.summary: Represents possible values of the field.

member.summary: If this flag is set in the event handler then the event will be suppressed from further propagation.
member.remarks: Suppressing events works only on Windows and macOS.

member.name: T:SharpHook.Native.EventType
member.summary: Represents the type of an input event which can be raised from a global hook or posted as a fake event.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.HookEnabled
member.summary: Raised when the global hook is started. Ignored when posted.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.HookDisabled
member.summary: Raised when the global hook is stopped. Ignored when posted.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.KeyTyped
member.summary: Raised when a character is typed. Ignored when posted.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.KeyPressed
member.summary: Raised when a key is pressed or posted to press a key.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.KeyReleased
member.summary: Raised when a key is released or posted to release a key.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseClicked
member.summary: Raised when a mouse button is clicked. Ignored when posted.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MousePressed
member.summary: Raised when a mouse button is pressed or posted to press a mouse button.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseReleased
member.summary: Raised when a mouse button is released or posted to release a mouse button.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseMoved
member.summary: Raised when the mouse is moved or posted to move the mouse.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseDragged
member.summary: Raised when the mouse is dragged. Not recommended to post as it will be the same as .

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseWheel
member.summary: Raised when the mouse wheel is scrolled or posted to scroll the mouse wheel.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MousePressedIgnoreCoordinates
member.summary: Posted to press a mouse button at the current coordinates. Never raised.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseReleasedIgnoreCoordinates
member.summary: Posted to release a mouse button at the current coordinates. Never raised.

member.name: F:SharpHook.Native.EventType.MouseMovedRelativeToCursor
member.summary: Posted to move the mouse relative to the current cursor position. Never raised.

member.name: T:SharpHook.SimpleGlobalHook
member.summary: Represents an implementation of which raises events on the same thread on which the hook itself runs.
member.remarks: The event handlers should generally be fast and simple so that the thread can process all raised events. If you need to do a lot of processing in the event handlers then consider using another implementation, e.g. .

member.name: M:SharpHook.SimpleGlobalHook.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.param: if should run the hook on a background thread. Otherwise, .

member.name: M:SharpHook.SimpleGlobalHook.#ctor(SharpHook.Providers.IGlobalHookProvider,System.Boolean)
member.param: if should run the hook on a background thread. Otherwise, .

member.name: T:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook
member.summary: Represents a task pool-based implementation of .

remarks.para: The event handlers will run with the specified parallelism level on separate threads inside the default thread pool for tasks. This way the hook itself will not be blocked if the handlers are long-running. The exception is the event which will run on the same thread that called the method since at that point it doesn't matter anymore that the hook is not blocked.
Setting inside the handlers will have no effect as they are run on other threads.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.#ctor
member.remarks: Calling this constructor is the same as passing to the other constructor.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.#ctor(SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHookOptions)
member.param: The options of the hook which include its parallelism level.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.#ctor(SharpHook.Providers.IGlobalHookProvider,SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHookOptions)
member.param: The options of the hook which include its parallelism level.

member.name: M:SharpHook.TaskPoolGlobalHook.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.param: if the method is called from the method. Otherwise, .
member.remarks: After calling this method, the hook cannot be started again. If you want to do that, create a new instance of .

member.summary: The default options with the parallelism level of 1.
member.value: The options with the parallelism level of 1.
